reviews.review: I have 935 hours in this game. I've played it on and off for years. I am yet to see them submit an update, that doesnt break the game further than it was already broken. Every update doubles bugs, even with things that werent touched. They have ignored the community for years not fixing base issues, whilst peddling money grabbing skins/rifts etc. The game is brilliant, when it works, which is once in a blue moon. By all means get it, but dont expect an easy ride. People need to stop buying content and hold them to account for the bullshit they keep pulling.
I enjoy playing this game and being toxic with other toxic people.

Do not get this game it is absolute garbage and you will be wasting your money.

The game is actually great and a lot of fun. There is a nice variety of characters with something for everyone. The basic premise of the game makes for exciting matches, and the details provide interesting tactical nuances. You have 4 survivors going against a killer. The killer is trying to sacrifice the survivors to a supernatural entity called "The Entity", and the four survivors try to get generators running to power a gate which they then open and escape. Every survivor and killer has their own unique perks (later unlockable for your other characters) and there are several generic perks you unlock and level up over time, and there's a nice variety of maps. The atmosphere of the game is great.

However, some maps have huge balancing problems, some are severely killer-sided whereas others are severely survivor-sided. Some are well-balanced though.

I am also not impressed by the pricing of the add-ons. This isn't a ruthless robbery like mobile P2W games, but the price is pretty hefty, especially because the system paywalls unique unlockable perks, directly affecting the gameplay experience. However, everyone can play on the DLC maps if they come up.

Most damningly, as of the time of this writing, there are loads of toxic players (particularly survivors) in the game, who ruin the fun for the others. I've had someone who hid out camping the hatch (some kind of emergency exit that normally opens when one player remains) when they felt survivors started to lose, not aiding the team at all; I've had a high rank survivor play with low rank friends trolling me as the killer with constant teabagging and wasting everyone's time by teabagging me for about a minute at the end half a meter away from the exit, instead of exiting and winning the match; killers refusing to play the game and just standing around doing nothing (this is a highly regular occurence); survivors DCing before getting killed to rob you of your points; all within the span of less than 20 hours playing the game, about half of which was spent in menus and having a blast playing with friends instead of random publics.
TL;DR; the playerbase is a fat pile of horse manure.

If you have friends to play this with I can wholeheartedly recommend it. Preferably four friends, so you can fill all slots yourself and never have to rely on pubs to play the game properly. This has the added boon that all perks and items are unlocked and levelled in custom matches, so you don't even have to bother with the levelling grind. If you don't have any friends or can't find them, forget this game and don't look back, it's not worth it.

CONTEÚDO RADIOATIVO, PERMANECER LONGE
---------------------------------------------------
Existem formas melhores de cometer suicídio.


A comunidade do DeadByDaylight reúne todos os males do mundo
 -Pessoas tóxicas sem mãe
 -Trolls
 -Pessoas que não aceitam perder e usam cheats 
 -Além de pessoas que acreditam em regras inexistentes, e caso você não siga, meu caro leitor, sofrerá o tsunami de lágrimas(de maior parte vindo dos sobreviventes, obviamente)
-Combo de bugs, que não só f*dem sua jogatina, como deixa o seu psicológico no fogo do inferno por alguns minutos

 Em geral, o DBD(como é carinhosamente chamado) é um jogo em que os killers têm que fugir dos sobreviventes, tomando cuidado com suas lanternas, obedecendo todas as regras que os sobreviventes impõem e sendo obrigado a assistir uma maravilhosa coreografia de Teabag no final da partida. Entretanto, não para por aí, você recebe um combo de "EZ" no chat do final da partida.

Um jogo super amigável, em que além de receber o jogo após a compra, deveríamos receber também uma equipe de psicólogos para nos ajudar a tratar os traumas causados pelo querido DeadByDaylight

ATENÇÃO: Se comprar, não irá ser capaz de reembolsar sua saúde mental. 

:)

-----------------------------------------------------

Devs are absolute dogshit and refuse to listen to any feedback ever. But its the only game left standing in this genre so I'm stuck here.

In it's core, this game is great. It's so simple and effective: 1 killer, 4 survivors. A spread out objective, and a race to escape before you're all dead.

However... over the years this game has become worse, and worse. I am now almost 100% sure that the original developers have been replaced, as any change is questionable at best and downright gamebreaking at worst.

The game IS getting better over the years. Some weird changes, but in the end they make it work enough to retain players.

Nowadays though, there is a public test build that should help the team get insight in what players do or do not like. Or what glaring bugs are present.

Do the devs use it this way? No. They just throw it in anyway.
There is a famous meme ''Pretty good job so far'' and it is still around to this day because it is still true. 
"You don't like it? Tough luck, suck it up 'cause it's going in either way.''

The latest killer was riddled with bugs, GLARING bugs, and was still released. It still has bugs and imbalances today.

The latest update has actually made me lose the last grain of hope for the game. 
I actually liked the idea of new character animations, and I'm all for these improvements to the game. But if what I get is outright ridiculous hitboxes (getting hit from a mile away, or unable to move through a bus in an unchanged map), and a middle finger when players point out that a UI is in no way an improvement (any UI designer would be able to tell you) and throw it in anyway.

I talk this in depth, because I LIKE this game. I love player killer or playing survivor with my friends. But killer is stressful, because there are a lot of things going on at a time. If I want to ''win'' as a killer I should be efficient, but not too efficient or I'll get punished. Never made it to rank 1 as a killer, because it always got too stressful and unfun for me starting at green ranks (9/20 or so) when I start going against full red teams (2/20 or so).

I'm here for fun. Updates should encourage fun. But the devs seem to not know what is best for the game. And any experienced player that could help, or voices ideas or improvements that actually would make sense... only get rewarded with another middlefinger.

Currently, I played a few games with friends as survivor and I can't use any ''skill'' I learned over my 800+ hours of gaming, because of glaring bugs. Walking through walls, getting hit from way too far off.... and I'll be damned if I have to be forced into meta perks or abuse game glitches to get through.

tl;dr.
This game was great fun with friends, or for the thrill of playing a killer with unique powers and tricks you could learn. But the developers seem to do their utmost best to turn as many players away from this game as possible. 
This game can still be fun, and I hope it becomes it once more in the future.... But I'm encountering aggravating things in each and every game right now, and it feels like there is nothing I can do about it.

Don't buy it.

It is discouraging how clear the disconnect between player and dev is with this game. There are issues that are detrimental to the player's experience and need fixing but they would rather make survivors walk like they have constipation. It's disappointing.

L̶e̶t̶'̶s̶ ̶s̶t̶a̶r̶t̶ ̶w̶i̶t̶h̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶U̶I̶,̶ ̶w̶h̶y̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶f̶u̶c̶k̶ ̶d̶o̶ ̶I̶ ̶n̶e̶e̶d̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶l̶o̶o̶k̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶e̶a̶c̶h̶ ̶c̶o̶r̶n̶e̶r̶ ̶o̶f̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶f̶u̶c̶k̶i̶n̶g̶ ̶s̶c̶r̶e̶e̶n̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶g̶e̶t̶ ̶b̶a̶s̶i̶c̶ ̶i̶n̶f̶o̶r̶m̶a̶t̶i̶o̶n̶ ̶t̶h̶a̶t̶ ̶w̶a̶s̶ ̶r̶e̶a̶d̶i̶l̶y̶ ̶a̶c̶c̶e̶s̶s̶i̶b̶l̶e̶ ̶i̶n̶ ̶o̶n̶e̶ ̶c̶o̶r̶n̶e̶r̶ ̶w̶i̶t̶h̶ ̶o̶n̶e̶ ̶g̶l̶a̶n̶c̶e̶!̶ ̶ (Updated UI positions are much better, similar to before)

The changes that are coming to decisive strike are a massive nerf to a perk that has already had 4! People that moan and complain about DS being uncounterable have no idea how to play against higher skilled players. I play survivor and killer 50/50 split, so can honestly say I have a pretty balanced view on DS. When I played killer, and suspected DS, just fucking slug and count for 60 seconds. It's really not difficult. This usually wouldn't happen because tunneling is very rarely a sound strategy. 

The only positive is the changes to Hex: Undying and the future change coming to matchmaking based off skill of playing a certain killer rather of rank. Hex: Undying needed this change, and it makes using the perk with other HEX's workable as opposed to just seeing ruin over and over again.
Last is the animations, why does my character look like they're struggling to get to the toilet before they shit themselves, and why does my character do a fucking pool dive when they're hit. 

A̶l̶l̶ ̶i̶n̶ ̶a̶l̶l̶,̶ ̶g̶o̶ ̶b̶a̶c̶k̶ ̶t̶o̶ ̶t̶h̶e̶ ̶l̶a̶s̶t̶ ̶v̶e̶r̶s̶i̶o̶n̶ ̶a̶n̶d̶ ̶ keep the change to HEX: Undying and matchmaking

(Edit - Leave DS alone my god!)

The game itself is fun (Aside from the horrible killer hitboxes and numerous bugs and glitches) 

Being tunneled or face-camped on first hook and on the other side of the coin constantly being flashlight stunned or having every hook sabotaged immediately and just dealing with one of the most toxic and sweaty communities in all of video games in general for both survivor and killer however is absolutely NOT fun.

Oh and I learned the hard way that you only solo-que as survivor if there's something severely wrong with your brain because you're just going to get a lobby of people who will either intentionally feed or farm you off hook or worst case scenario just let you die on your first hook. The game is practically unplayable without friends because of this.

I put 300 more hours into it on PS4 after I quit playing on PC and I'll just say that I've never done crack, but I'd imagine that this game is the equivalent of it. Fun at first for that immediate intense high and adrenaline rush, but horrible for your long term health and will cause depression after the high and you just feel so much better once you finally manage to kick the addiction all together.

Just wish I could get my 500 hours back.

I Recommend this game for people to at least try it. 

The game is worth the buy and you will get your money's worth out of it, but for the long term investment don't expect to love the game fully. Very close to cs:go in a sense you will love/hate the game. 

-The Developers are slowly turning into valve employees adding new content to the game and 
 skins for you to spend money.
-The Latest UI changes was literally a flashback to when CS:GO gun sounds where changed. 
 NOBODY asked for the changes. I feel that the UI situation could have been handled 
 differently with minor changes that could benefit the player, but e.g (layering light red on dark 
 red) was not the way to go forward.
-The player base was very happy with the game as it was. Some change was needed like the 
 animations are a nice touch I could get use to and surely other players as well. It gave the 
 game a bit more of a refreshing feeling. (A little bit of something new.)
-There are still quite a few BUGS that need to be sorted out which i believe will  be sorted 
 within a few weeks hopefully or when the next updates are released. / One bug i have 
 personalty experienced was when i loaded into the game as a survivor and one of my 
 teammates left causing the match to be cancelled which to my surprise i had depipped while 
 on the scoreboard everyone having accumulated 0 Blood points.
-This game has a lot of diversity in the sense of you being able to play SURVIVOR or KILLER 
 with a wide range of characters to select out of all having different play styles according to 
 that character (or their specific perks if you choose to play with those perks).

The players can be toxic, that's just par for the course with PVP. I do have fun playing killer, and even survivor with the right groups and often just play with friends. I do wish the rift challenges didn't lock you into playing killers that you are uncomfortable with. My main issue with the game is that when players rapid flash the flashlight it triggers seizures sometimes. Which causes me to have to stop playing in a match or drop out completely depending on severity, or take extended breaks from the game. If survivors wouldn't flashlight after flashlight me it'd be more tolerable, however, it is part of the game. Just be aware!
Didn't know each killer had commando pro after this update.

This review is based over playing since beta. I have a lot of hours as the game was fun at the start. Introduction of DLC has slowly worn down the game making bugs and imbalances alike come to show. If you're looking to unlock all perks on all survivors and killers, expect a couple of thousand of hours in the game before you have unlocked it all. Devs won't change this as they are blinded and think everybody is 'enjoying this progression in the game'

The devs really aren't interested in the community in this game. 
PTB's are purely for them to get free bug testing, they don't care about impressions from the community
Updates will be rolled out regardless of what the player base thinks of it, they are never rolled back despite bugs being game breaking (hit boxes, broken perks, stuck animations etc)
DLC is prioritised over bug fixes
Time estimates are rarely given on when these bug fixes are coming.

Despite there being over 160 perks between killer and survivor, only around 20% of these are used so once you get to high ranks (which is based on playtime, not skill) you'll continue to play the same killers running the same perks. Same for killer, you'll come across survivors using the same perks, the gameplay becomes quite stale.

The devs takes ages to respond to perks that are considered overpowered and in need nerfing. They tend to modify perks nobody uses for the worst. Sometimes nerfs for perks nobody uses either, how strange.

If you do want to get this game though, grit your teeth and get your shit bucket because it's going to be a long one.

Y los lloriqueos abundan. Pero la verdad la comunidad no afecta la jugabilidad que es lo k se supone nos interesa, ya que no hay comunicacion alguna dentro del juego, a menos que te quedes como mazoquita a ver k t escriben al final de la partida, para luego ir a llorar a facebook. El juego es muy divertido y me gusta mucho.
